column4: ï»¿I have a Intel 82801H HD Audio Controller on a Mitac laptop with Ubuntu 8.04. However, I hear no sound when attempting to play something. What could be wrong?
also check that you are in the audio group
lsmod | grep snd should spit something out too
I see snd_hda_intel
looks like the alsa module is in there but i think it is a bit on the empty side. check what the mixer says, does it see anything?
It's all unmuted, volume at the highest.
and you are in the group "audio"?
I triple checked.
Yes, according to `groups`
not sure how ububtu should do it but on my debian i can see a crapload of snd when i do a quick 'lsmod | grep snd'. things like snd, snd-pcm-oss, snd-pcm and others
I phoned the place of purchase, they said that the drivers that ships with Ubuntu is out-of-date and had to compile ALSA by hand.
ouch. what kind of system you run there?
Laptop...
a bit more would be helpful
I can't find any newer version than 1.0.16 (which ships with Ubuntu 8.0.4) on their FTP site.
Mitac.
i see. but.... usually the modules come with the kernel, is that an ubuntu kernel you have there? 'uname -a'
It's a fresh installation from a Ubuntu 8.04 LTS live CD.
on the other hand, if that is an OEM install, maybe calling the manufacturer would help. no idea if they have some strange things going on there
I installed it myself.
